Title: Italy’s Piombino LNG FSRU to start commercial operations in early May
Description: Italy’s gas transmission system operator Snam is going ahead with the launch of a new 5 bn m3 LNG floating storage and regasification unit (FSRU) in May. A court has delayed its ruling on the terminal to early July, but this has no impact on the  start of commercial operations planned for early May. Italy is turning to LNG to ensure its security of supply amid the EU’s pivot away from Russian pipeline gas.
Author: DE

Title: Kansai Electric shuts one 0.9 GW Maizuru coal plant unit, impact on LNG may be minimal
Description: Japanese utility Kansai Electric has taken offline one of two units at its 1.8 GW Maizuru coal-fired plant in Kyoto due to a fire yesterday, with the timeline for its return to production unclear. Industry participants, however, don’t expect the shutdown to lead to increased spot LNG purchases to compensate for the coal-fired capacity loss.
Author: CK
